course_title: Special Topics in Philosophy: On Property
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 18 / Seats Avail: 15Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes:
Title: On Property
This course attends to ideas of property in the seventeenth and eighteenth centuries. We will ask if humans are morally and ethically justifiable to own and possess entities such as land, plants, animals, or even other humans. The readings in this course will range from philosophy and political thought to literature and history
course_description: Selected topics and problems in philosophy. Content will vary in successive offerings of this course. May be repeated for credit when topic varies.
